title: Stored XSS on activity
content:
Hi security team members,
Description
I found a store xss on the activity which allows an attacker to steal admin account cookies.
Step to reproduce
1-Create store
2- Add a member in a store
3- Member can choose any name
4- So change the any member name with hunter"><svg/onload=alert(2)>
5- Now on admain account make changes
6- That will create activity with attacker malicious payload
POC
<image_0>
Impact
An attacker(staff member) can takeover admin account.
steps: Add a member to the store
Change the member's name to a malicious payload: hunter"><svg/onload=alert(2)>
Log in to the admin account and make changes to trigger the activity with the malicious payload
vuln_description: A stored XSS vulnerability in the activityDescription field allows a member to inject malicious JavaScript, which executes when an admin views the activity log. This can lead to cookie theft and account takeover.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward XSS injection in a user-controllable field (member name) that is reflected in the admin interface. The attack does not require complex interactions or deep understanding of the application's logic.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves a stored XSS where a member can inject malicious payloads into the activity description, which is then executed in the admin's context. This is detectable because the methodology involves testing actions with different user sessions (including admin sessions) and observing if unauthorized actions (like executing malicious scripts) can be performed.
